revised_title: Exceptional Fern Leaf Development and the Apex of Osmunda and Todea
tldr: The author examines the development of fern leaves, specifically the apex of Osmunda and Todea, and discovers a three-sided apical cell in contrast to the typical two-sided cell found in other ferns. This unique structure is found to be an intermediate step in leaf development, bridging the gap between ferns and other plant groups like Marathacece and Cycadece.
